findings.title: Authentication is not enabled for some Manager’s endpoints
findings.description: The `/api/v1/jobs` and `/preheats` endpoints in Manager web UI are accessible without authentication, allowing any user with network access to create, delete, and modify jobs, and create preheat jobs.

findings.title: Manager makes requests to external endpoints with disabled TLS authentication
findings.description: The Manager disables TLS certificate verification in two HTTP clients.

findings.title: Incorrect handling of a task structure's usedTraffic field
findings.description: The 'usedTraffic' field is handled incorrectly due to uninitialized variable usage as a guard for method calls.

findings.title: Directories created via os.MkdirAll are not checked for permissions
findings.description: Lack of pre-existence or post-verification checks for newly created files and directories when using os.MkdirAll.

findings.title: Slicing operations with hard-coded indexes and without explicit length validation
findings.description: Array slicing operations are performed with hard-coded indexes without explicit length validation, which can cause a panic if the arrays are smaller than the indexes.

findings.title: Files are closed without error check
findings.description: In multiple locations throughout the codebase, files are not explicitly closed or checked for errors after writing, leading to undefined behavior when disk failures occur.

findings.title: Timing attacks against Proxy’s basic authentication are possible
findings.description: The access control mechanism for the Proxy feature uses simple string comparisons and is therefore vulnerable to timing attacks.

findings.title: Possible panics due to nil pointer dereference when using variables created alongside an error
findings.description: Dereferencing the first return value of a function even when it returns an error can result in a `nil` dereference, causing code to panic.

findings.title: TrimLeft is used instead of TrimPrefix
findings.description: The code uses strings.TrimLeft instead of strings.TrimPrefix which may lead to incorrect trimming results.

findings.title: Vertex.DeleteInEdges and Vertex.DeleteOutEdges functions are not thread safe
findings.description: The `Vertex.DeleteInEdges` and `Vertex.DeleteOutEdges` methods are prone to inconsistent state due to race conditions between threads, causing a parent vertex to have the child in its `Children` set but the child vertex not having the parent in its `Parents` set.

findings.title: Arbitrary file read and write on a peer machine
findings.description: Peers can send requests to create files in arbitrary file system locations and read arbitrary files, allowing them to steal secret data and gain remote code execution capabilities.

findings.title: Manager generates mTLS certificates for arbitrary IP addresses
findings.description: A peer can obtain a valid TLS certificate for arbitrary IP addresses, effectively rendering the mTLS authentication useless.

findings.title: gRPC requests are weakly validated
findings.description: The gRPC requests are weakly validated, and some requests' fields are not validated at all.
